block.p: Street Sense's victory by a nose in the Tampa Bay Derby on Saturday was a rousing return for the 2-year-old champion. On that performance alone, the colt is our Kentucky Derby favorite.
By JOE DRAPE
HORSE: 1. Street Sense TRAINER: Carl Nafzger JOCKEY: Calvin Borel Will try to become the first Derby winner since Sunny's Halo in 1983 to have only two starts as a 3-year-old. Next: Blue Grass.
HORSE: 2. Nobiz Like Shobiz TRAINER: Barclay Tagg JOCKEY: Cornelio Velazquez Must rebound from a loss to Scat Daddy in the Fountain of Youth. Next: Wood Memorial.
HORSE: 3. Scat Daddy TRAINER: Todd Pletcher JOCKEY: John Velazquez This son of Johannesburg is tough and has a big heart. Next: Florida Derby.
HORSE: 4. Any Given Saturday TRAINER: Todd Pletcher JOCKEY: John Velazquez Gave Street Sense all he could handle in the stretch of the Tampa Bay Derby. Next: uncertain.
HORSE: 5. Great Hunter TRAINER: Doung O'Neill JOCKEY: Corey Nakatani An impressive winner of the Robert Lewis Stakes on Saturday. Next: the Blue Grass.

HORSE: 6. Ravel TRAINER: Todd Pletcher JOCKEY: Garrett Gomez Another of Pletcher's deep lineup. Won the Sham off a maiden victory and will try to win the Derby off only two preps. Next: Santa Anita Derby.
HORSE: 7. Circular Quay TRAINER: Todd Pletcher JOCKEY: Garrett Gomez The Louisiana Derby winner is 4 for 7 overall with a stone-cold-closing running style. Next: uncertain.

HORSE: 8. Stormello TRAINER: William Currin JOCKEY: Kent Desormeaux Hollywood Futurity champion acquitted himself well when he came east and lost by a nose to Scat Daddy in the Fountain of Youth. The six stake races he has run add to his seasoning. Next: uncertain.
HORSE: 9. Notional TRAINER: Doug O'Neill JOCKEY: Corey Nakatani Has won his two starts as a 3-year-old, most recently the Risen Star Stakes. Next: Florida Derby.
HORSE: 10. Cobalt Blue TRAINER: Doug O'Neill JOCKEY: Victor Espinoza Owned by Merv Griffin, he was a two-length winner in the San Felipe Stakes. Next: llinois Derby.
Street Sense's victory by a nose in the Tampa Bay Derby on Saturday was a rousing return for the 2-year-old champion. On that performance alone, the colt is our Kentucky Derby favorite.
